2. Using image overlays or dynamic watermarks that discourage users from taking screenshots.
3. Using third-party tools or libraries that detect when a screenshot is taken and respond by disabling the functionality or showing an error message.
4. Using hardware-level encryption to protect your data and prevent unauthorized access.
